newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard rallies.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard rallies.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co's news of robust quarterly results drove the shares higher preceding Wednesday's U.S. market open, extending a rally kicked off in after-hours trade last night.
Hewlett-Packard shares climbed to 54-1/2 in active third market trade, adding to Tuesday's after-hours 1-7/8 gain to 51-3/8.
The company reported last night fiscal first quarter earnings of $0.87 per share, $0.12 better than both the First Call consensus analysts' forecast and year-ago results.
The company's revenues climbed to $10.29 billion from $9.29 billion, it said.
Also helping the shares higher were upgrades by brokerages Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette and Morgan Stanley, traders said.
Morgan Stanley raised the stock to outperform from neutral and DLJ lifted it to buy from market perform.
Petroleum Geo-Services A/S American Depositary Receipts were singled out for early U.S. buying, following overseas investing on news of new large contract, traders said.
The Norwegian marine oilfield and seismic services company said it won a $350 million contract from Conoco, a unit of DuPont Co, to build and operate a floating oil production ship.
The ADRs were quoted at 45-5/8 bid, 44-5/8 ask, up from Tuesday's 44-1/4 Nasdaq close.
Among other stocks active before the U.S. market open, MCI Communications Corp, rose 1/8 to 36-1/4, Intel slipped to 154-1/8 from 154-5/8 and Microsoft shed 1/8 to 97-1/4.

Also, Hadco Corp shares tumbled 4-1/2 to 50 before the open after reporting last night a loss of $6.64 per share after research and development write-offs versus a profit of $0.65 per share one year ago.
Alex. Brown also downgraded the stock to buy from strong buy.
